basics.name: Daniel Brahaney
basics.label: Senior Quality/DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Dedicated and hardworking professional who is passionate about DevOps, test automation, quality and cloud software development. Ready to take on any challenge, and excited to contribute to new technology and grow as a part of a great team. In my work on test automation, I have become fascinated with all aspects of engineering best practices, including CI/CD, testing, change management, and site reliability engineering. I would welcome the opportunity to dive into any of these areas of expertise.

work.name: IDEXX
highlights: Came up to speed on a very complex veterinary laboratory business domain as well as a large distributed software ecosystem across multiple clouds and technologies quickly
Perform exploratory testing on new features being developed for in-house laboratory information management system (LIMS) for IDEXX global vet labs
Discover and report defects to developers, working closely with business and product to determine whether or not issues are a priority to invest in
Actively participate in grooming of new feature stories to ensure full understanding of testing scope and method
Contribute regularly to large library of Postman requests used during our testing
Assist developers in writing automated acceptance tests for defects and new features
Write and contribute to cypress UI testing
Assist in monitoring during deployment windows to find any issues quickly so that DevOps team can address them
Created new framework for testers to pull logs from many contexts at once by trace ID across multiple cloud logging services (GCP, Azure, and kubernetes) to make tracking actions easier

work.name: Motorola Solutions Inc
highlights: Redesigned and reimplemented framework for testing on-camera AI analytics capabilities for Avigilon and Pelco security cameras

Helped add capabilities to our test framework for presenting videos to cameras, analyzing detection results, and doing statistical analysis against ground truth and previous results to determine test success
Lead the team in designing dozens of tests of our product's AI capabilities
Lead the team in adopting modern technologies (such as VS Code, docker, and modern CI/CD with GitHub Actions)
Worked closely with developers on new features to ensure testability would be a consideration of feature design and implementation
Filed detailed bug reports on issues discovered via manual or automated testing
Integrated our testing tools into firmware CI/CD pipeline to bring test results to development teams earlier
Created documentation and training materials and sessions to enable development teams to add more tests to our framework on their own
Mentored junior members of our QA team, including several co-ops, on testing, coding in python, CI/CD and more

work.name: Meltwater
highlights: Wrote new test automation framework in python, using pytest, for statistical model APIs created by our data science team

Wrote a test automation framework for validating intermittently-unreliable live data feeds, processing millions of events per day and visualizing error rates and other results in Kibana, and alerting the team if thresholds for incomplete/unusable events are reached. Allowing for simple addition of validation cases whenever engineering discovers a potential issue.
Worked with developers to build load/performance testing with locust, testing API endpoints deployed to kubernetes while capturing kubernetes resource utilization data for the pods under test
Deployed data validation framework using Serverless Framework as AWS lambda triggered by SNS/SQS
Due to certain data sources not on AWS, re-worked data validation framework to also be deployable direct to kubernetes
Worked with data scientists and software engineers across two teams to improve unit testing, data validation and test automation

Worked closely with Product Manager on new feature specifications, ensuring that the specifications are clear enough to avoid misunderstandings and ensure the best quality work from our engineering teams.

Worked closely with UX designers on design specs, ensuring usability and making sure the designs provided were able to be implemented. Reducing back-and-forth time between UX and developers prior to/during implementation
Logged defects, verified fixes
Aided in PR reviews and unit test case development
Implemented snyk and SonarCloud into CI/CD pipeline for additional quality/security feedback for teams
Regularly reviewed snyk/sonar results with team, logging Jira cards for issues worth fixing

work.name: Red Hat
highlights: Performed manual and automated testing on RedHat OpenShift's internal software-defined networking modules. Primarily worked with ovn-kubernetes.
built, managed and troubleshot OpenShift (kubernetes) clusters for testing and development
Logged defects, and verified defect fixes prior to release
Performed regression testing after security/bug fixes were backported to older supported OpenShift versions
Performed new test-case reviews for team mates, PR reviews for automation code commits

Lead a small breakout team to rework automated testing CI pipeline to require less manual intervention. Previously, test results for dozens or more test runs per day needed to be manually reviewed, informing QA teams of failures that need to be investigated. We developed a chatbot that could alert necessary teams in Slack based on testcase ownership and a database of known errors, leaving only a small portion of "unknown" errors up to manual intervention, freeing up at least 30 hours a week of engineering time from this continuous task.

work.name: NS1
highlights: Expanded automated testing of NS1's customer premise deployed DNS solution
Created and maintained Postman collections for all API endpoints
Integrated Postman collections into test framework

Developed a new test framework "supersoaker" for "soak" testing. These tests ran for many days at a time, simulating to some degree basic customer use cases and regression-testing against various race conditions and over-consuming processing resource issues that had previously been discovered
Deployed "supersoaker" to kubernetes clusters for long-running tests
Reviewed unit test cases written by developers, assisting in improving unit test coverage and efficacy

work.name: Akamai Technologies
highlights: Designed and implemented "trestle" a set of APIs with integrations to a WebEx Teams chatbot that can provide an interface for automations to streamline support, both for customer support and for our internal product support team.
Wrote playbooks and documentation, in conjunction with new trestle tooling, to help customer support solve more issues without escalating their cases to our team.
Wrote test automation for production monitoring, to give higher visibility into commonly occurring issues in order to address them before customer support escalations.
work.summary: DevOps Engineer for a Product Support team, automating support operations and investigating customer issues

work.name: Dyn (Acquired by Oracle 2016)
highlights: Built a new test framework for end-to-end testing in python, Robot Framework, Selenium and Docker
Hosted framework as a platform in kubernetes providing scheduling, metrics, alerting and visualization using statsd, graphite, grafana, logstash, kibana, PagerDuty and Slack
Built a slackbot for triggering and checking the status of test runs
Running tests against production applications were used to collect data for KPIs and SLAs by numerous teams
Assisted teams with developing testing strategies and writing better tests
Maintained SonarQube for static analysis testing across the organization
work.summary: I worked on a small team dedicated to providing better tooling and training around testing and quality assurance. We built tools, defined standards and provided training and assistance with all things testing.

work.name: Single Digits, Inc.
highlights: Wrote and executed manual and automated test cases
Took an environment of 100% manual tests and automated 70% within 6 months, reducing 8-16 hours per week of manual testing time
Built an automation framework using python and selenium and incorporated it into CI/CD pipeline
Managed a lab of nearly 100 network equipment components, including routers, switches, access points and VMWare clusters used in testing
Wrote a framework for automatically provisioning equipment in the lab before each test suite is run
Worked extensively with HP, Cisco, Nomadix, SolutionInc, OpenFlow, Tallac, Aruba, Motorola and Ruckus networking technologies to emulate customer premise networks
work.summary: Work as part of the Software Development team, ensuring stability and interoperability between our custom software platform and our customer premise network hardware and software, as well as testing for quality and seamless operation of our network management software solutions

work.name: Single Digits, Inc.
highlights: Wrote new internal technical documentation for many aspects of our software and services that had not been documented at all, or updated in too long
Built a wiki and managed it for the entire organization
Handled escalations from Support that exceed support engineering's capabilities, and provide documented solutions in case similar issues arise
Logged significant number of defects with software engineering staff, eventually leading to my promotion to QA Engineer
work.summary: Work as part of a cross-functional internal support team tasked with improving knowledge sharing and understanding of common problems and solutions across our thousands of customers' networks and integrations with our software.

work.name: Single Digits, Inc.
work.summary: Provide technical support to hotels, malls, apartment complexes and their guests all around the world. Taking incoming calls and providing excellent customer service, helping to resolve their connectivity problems in a timely manner. In addition, a Specialist's duties include assisting the team Supervisor with leadership tasks, training and mentoring, and general technical assistance within the team as a subject matter expert.

work.name: Single Digits, Inc.
work.summary: Provide technical support to hotels, malls, apartment complexes and their guests all around the world. Taking incoming calls and providing excellent customer service, helping to resolve their connectivity problems in a timely manner.
